content.raw:
Hosting the key in the repo [is not difficult](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/host_repo_key%0Ddefault#diff). 

Modifying the instructions to use fingerprints [is ready](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/branches/compare/use_fingerprint_to_install%0Ddefault#diff). With this change we save the installation of wget and trust on the apt-key tool to handle the whole process for us, which I think is a good thing. However, as you said, we will lost the abstraction over the key fingerprint and need to change documentation when the key changes (hopefully not very often).
content.html:
Hosting the key in the repo is not difficult.

Modifying the instructions to use fingerprints is ready. With this change we save the installation of wget and trust on the apt-key tool to handle the whole process for us, which I think is a good thing. However, as you said, we will lost the abstraction over the key fingerprint and need to change documentation when the key changes (hopefully not very often).
